actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 364.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Onder moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 364 â€” "Calling upon local communities to support organizations that provide resources and aid Gold Shield Families in their time of need."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Thanedar notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Craig to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 13.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mariannette Miller-Meeks to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
